question.text: A person with chronic kidney failure will have

options.text: high blood urea and high serum creatinine levels
high blood urea and low serum creatinine levels
low blood urea and high serum creatinine levels
low blood urea and low serum creatinine levels

solution.text: In chronic kidney failure, the kidneys are not functioning properly. This results in a rise in urea levels in the blood as kidneys are not able to remove urea. Creatinine is a waste product that is produced by muscles due to the breakdown of creatine. This is then removed from kidneys through urine. Due to chronic failure the creatinine gets accumulated and thus amount increases in the blood.
